thread.title: 'Moving To India, Best Decision Ever': Canadian Shares How 8 Years In The Country Changed His Life | VIDEO | Viral - Times Now
thread.title_full: 'Moving To India, Best Decision Ever': Canadian Shares How 8 Years In The Country Changed His Life | VIDEO | Viral - Times Now

author: Surbhi Kaul
title: 'Moving To India, Best Decision Ever': Canadian Shares How 8 Years In The Country Changed His Life | VIDEO | Viral - Times Now
text:
The Canadian living in India for the past eight years, Caleb Friesen, has built a significant fanbase among Indian audiences. His videos on Instagram have consistently gone viral because he highlights both the good and bad sides of India, keeping his perspective neutral, which the internet has largely supported. In his latest video, which is going viral, he shared that “moving to India was one of the best decisions he ever made.”
'Moving To India, Best Decision Ever': Canadian Shares How 8 Years In The Country Changed His Life (Image Source - @caleb_friesen/X)
Sharing the video on Instagram and X, he captioned it: “Moving to India was one of the best decisions I've ever made.” In the video, he says, "I've been living in India for more than eight years, and at this point in my life, it's very clear to me that moving here was one of the smartest decisions I've ever made. Here's why. There's a narrative I've noticed, especially from travel influencers, and it's something that pops up a lot on X and other social media platforms. It often feels like there's an effort to put India down. These influencers tend to focus on things that are falling apart, messy, or dirty. They come to India, make videos highlighting these aspects, and then leave. The story they end up telling the world is that India is a dirty, stinky country—or an underpriced asset—but that's only one part of the story."
He further shared, "What many fail to see is how much else is happening in India. They don’t notice the rapid growth in Indian tech, the evolving economy, and the transforming business landscape. Being here, I feel like I’ve gotten in on the ground floor of something huge. It’s like discovering something before everyone else does—a kind of insider knowledge about a place that’s going to change dramatically in the next decade or two."
He concluded, "In fact, it already has. If you look at India in the 90s or early 2000s and compare it to today, the progress is staggering. And this pace is only going to accelerate. That’s why moving to India was one of the best decisions I’ve ever made. I just wanted to make this video because I feel like 2026 is going to be an even bigger year for Indian development, and especially for Indian technology. I’m excited for the next few years and feel extremely privileged to be part of this story."
His video has since gone viral, garnering mixed reactions online. Caleb mostly lives in Bengaluru, and on several occasions, he has highlighted issues such as potholes and other city problems, which the internet has largely agreed with him on.
